entries.source: Chat Edit: 'OK, so it's apparent this isn't going to work. Let's rollback to using the mouse to navigate, but I'd like to keep the ability to cancel with the ESC key if that's an option. If not, we'll go back to mouse only navigation and clicking on the button to cancel.'

Chat Edit: 'If I open the power menu and click cancel, initially if I click Cancel, it cancels. I reopen the menu, click Lock and the screen locks. After signing back in, the menu is still open (it should close after clicking an option) and now clicking cancel does nothing, ESC does nothing but clicking the power button does close the menu.'

Chat Edit: 'I would like to further tweak the way quickshell operates now that we have all of the main functionality in place.

Is it possible to make the app launcher, calendar and power menu widgets appear to expand or grow out of the bar? 

So the app launcher would expand out of the bar just under the Arch logo button and be a narrow column of apps. The search function can be removed because it doesn't work anyway.

The calendar would spring open right under the date and time in the bar, and the power menu can spring open from under the power button. Change the power menu layout to be a single column.

If available, I would also like to assign each of these widgets a key bind:

App launcher - $mainMod, A, exec, $menu
Calendar - $mainMod, C, exec, $calendar
Power menu - $mainMod, ESC, exec, $powermenu

The variables above exist under MY PROGRAMS in hyprland.conf, but need to be assigned to whatever command is used to call these widgets.

Caelestia Shell uses this effect when opening some of it's bar widgets, so I know this is possible. Refer to the Caelestia Shell directory if needed.
'

Chat Edit: 'I would like to further tweak the way quickshell operates now that we have all of the main functionality in place.

So the app launcher would expand out of the bar just under the Arch logo button and be a narrow column of apps. The search function can be removed because it doesn't work anyway.

The calendar would spring open right under the date and time in the bar, and the power menu can spring open from under the power button. Change the power menu layout to be a single column.

Caelestia Shell uses this effect when opening some of it's bar widgets, so I know this is possible. Refer to the Caelestia Shell directory if needed.
'

Chat Edit: 'The widgets look pretty good, but I'd like to refine them further. The app laucher can be simplified even further by removing the description of each application and only display the app icon and name.

The calendar is perfect how it is!

For the power menu, the last item appears to be cutoff because the widget isn't tall enough. 

I am also attaching a screenshot to show that the widgets have a pretty good sized gap between them and the bar. if it's not possible to remove the gap, that's ok.

'

Chat Edit: 'That makes sense--thank you for your explanation! I'm happy with what we've made. it looks really good and works pretty well, too.

One thing that needs tweaked is the selection highlight for the power menu. I noticed that the styling of the highlight is different between the calendar widget's current date and the selected option from the power menu (see screenshot). 

I would like to see the power menu selection highlight match the calendar's current date highlight.

I wish there was a way to provide visual feedback in the app launcher besides the mouse pointer when hovering over apps. Is it possible to add a matching highlight to the apps?

Another thing to be aware of is that many of the accent colors do not have good contrast with the text, so when highlighting occurs, it would be nice to see the text use a dark color. (See screenshot of theme-picker for contrast issue example.)

Nord in particular has a weird issue or two--the theme-switcher has some odd highlighting (see screenshot) and the hyprshot gui window is also wonky, but I can't screenshot it to show you, unfortunately. I'm not sure what can done for that.'

Chat Edit: 'Congrats, the theme switcher is working very well now! 

Can we add a border to the other quickshell widgets, too? App launcher, power menu and the calendar widget are all borderless right now.'

Chat Edit: 'Here is another example of a lack of a unified UI. This is the catppuccin theme, but this happens with all of the themes. And at least one, Dracula, uses an even different aesthetic than the others.

I like that there is a contrast between the application header in the app launcher, then the list is contained in a lighter colored card within the main card. The power menu has a different look with each individual option having a lighter background and the selected option is using the account color. With the theme-switcher, there is a faint line separator between the title and options, and a slightly darker background.

I would like the darker background used for all widgets, and use the card-within-a-card look that was used for the app launcher for the power menu and theme-switcher, too. The inner card ca be lighter than the background color to add contrast and the selected option should use the accent color for each theme.

As I mentioned earlier, Dracula being different than the rest, it seems like those widgets have a flat appearance with text on a single-colored background. I would like that changes so there is a dark background, lighter card to contrast with accent colors for the selected option and the border. See screenshot.

For contrast, here is the TokyoNight themed calendar widget which has good contrast. 

And finally, RosePine, which has contrast, but not enough. this one also needs adjustment. 
'

Chat Edit: 'In going through all of the themes, I realized that the TokyoNight theme has an issue. The app launcher and clock widgets have a uniform style, but the power menu has a different color scheme. A screenshot is attached to display the differences.'

Chat Edit: 'All issues seem to be fixed now, both with the window mode screenshot tool and the vscodium staying on top of every workspace. I'm not sure how the latter happened, but rebooting fixed it.

Is it easy to implement using the arrow keys for the app launcher and power menu widgets? I would like to be able to open the widget with the keybind, then navigate up and down with the arrow keys and press Enter to select the desired app or option. Not being able to use the keyboard is an issue for a keyboard based window manager like Hyprland.'

Chat Edit: 'This is partially working. The first item in both widgets is still highlighted initially, then when I hover the mouse over subsequent items, that items is highlight but it flashes back to the first items when the pointer is between hotspots.'

Chat Edit: 'That's interesting because the first item is indeed highlighted and when another item is moused over, the highlight flickers back and forth when I move down the list. You might need to take a closer look.'

Chat Edit: 'Yes, that solved it! Great job!

Would it be hard to add an icon similar to the one used on the wallpaper picker widget to close the window for the other widgets?'
Chat Edit: 'The wallpaper picker doesn't have the outline around the button in the inactive state. Can we remove the border from the other widgets, too?'
